page.title: 15Pye corner farm, continued
page.content: {(cont. from p.13)}1 sledge to go behind a bail maker, tractor loader which does allsorts of things,corn drill, 1 plough, lots of harrows,a fertiliser,and a dung spreader.One boy had an accident on a tractor ,where it rolled on him,and he died.Animals are sold for about 3 or 400 pounds a ton.Barley is a little less money that wheat.John Marsh owned Pye Corner Farm when it was an inn.The types of cows are Hereford,Hereford cross Fresian, Aberdeen Angus, Charolais cross Fresian, Devon, Fresian and Chianina. The soil around is very sandy and this means it is weedy.Last year was very good for the farm because of the sun. The grain was smaller but heavier. Â£2000000 of grain went to Africa.Mrs Hodder herself inspects the cattle and corn and looks for diseases.In her spare time she makes corn dollys.
